text: Brandon Joseph Fremin (born April 9, 1974) is an American attorney who currently serves as the United States Attorney for the Middle District of Louisiana. ==Biography== Fremin received his Bachelor of Arts, cum laude, from Southeastern Louisiana University, and his Juris Doctor from the Paul M. Hebert Law Center at Louisiana State University. He enlisted in the United States Marine Corps in 1994, where he served until 2002 when he was honorably discharged as a platoon sergeant. He previously served as an Assistant District Attorney in the Office of the District Attorney for the 19th Judicial District of Louisiana and as an Assistant United States Attorney in the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Middle District of Louisiana. Prior to his appointment as U.S. Attorney, he served as the Director of the Criminal Division for the Office of the Louisiana Attorney General. ==United States Attorney for the Middle District of Louisiana== On November 1, 2017, Fremin was nominated by President Donald Trump to be the next United States Attorney for the Middle District of Louisiana. On February 8, 2018, his nomination was reported out of committee by voice vote.Results of Executive Business Meeting – February 8, 2018, Senate Judiciary Committee On February 15, 2018, his nomination was confirmed by voice vote. He was sworn into office on February 23, 2018. ==References== ==External links== * Biography at U.S. Department of Justice Category:1974 births Category:Living people Category:Assistant United States Attorneys Category:District attorneys in Louisiana Category:Louisiana State University Law Center alumni Category:People from Baton Rouge, Louisiana Category:Southeastern Louisiana University alumni Category:United States Attorneys for the Middle District of Louisiana Category:United States Marines Category:20th-century American lawyers Category:21st-century American lawyers
title: Brandon Fremin
